definitions.definition: a condition giving a greater chance of success:
examples: The advantage of booking tickets in advance is that you get better seats.

definitions.definition: to use the good things in a situation:
examples: I thought I'd take advantage of the sports facilities while I'm here.

definitions.definition: to treat someone badly in order to get something good from them:
examples: I think she takes advantage of his good nature.

definitions.definition: the word used in tennis when a player has won the point after deuce:
In games such as football, if a referee plays advantage, they do not stop the game when there is a foul because allowing play to continue gives an advantage to the team that has been fouled:
examples: The ref should have played advantage because Rooney would have been through on goal.
